conclusion: Analyze the direction and impact of the light on each object to determine shadow changes.
Light source is initially positioned to cast shadows behind and to the left of the objects.
A is the shadow of the cylindrical object.
B is the shadow of the small brown object.
C is the shadow of the large white object.
D is the shadow of the paper airplane.
When the light source moves to the front right, shadows will shift in direction towards the back left.
Distance from the light source to the objects increases, affecting the size and distortion of the shadows.
Shadow A moves to the back left and becomes slightly larger.
Shadow B moves to the back left and becomes slightly larger.
Shadow C moves to the back left and becomes slightly larger.
Shadow D moves to the back left and becomes slightly larger.
Final answer: A, B, C, and D move to the back left and become slightly larger.
